job_title: COTA in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Excellent workplace environment and a wonderfully skilled team of therapists to collaborate with.

review_title: Make like Forest Gump and Run Away
job_title: Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: You get to work with the elderly and they are great. You also get to help people.
cons: Management is terrible. Managers will talk badly about you to other employees including slandering you. HR knows what is happening with management and does nothing about it. If you complain you will be fired. There is unethical business practices going on and this is documented in the system if someone would just look. If you are not wiling to lie and bend your morals you will not last here. Also, benefits are awful and pay is not compensatory to everything you are expected to do. You will have no work/life balance here. And unless you are willing to be immoral, there is no room for advancement.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: There are some hard working individuals in this group and some good folks with great personalities who make it easy to work with.
cons: The CEO purposes ideas of creating a great culture but in reality it's a good old boys club. Very few opinions are taken into account outside of the few in the ELT team who tend to lead and make all decisions for the betterment of themselves and not for the company. This isn't a great place to work if culture is most important to you, as you won't be considered valuable as an employee. Also, the executive leadership team lacks the skills and knowledge to effectively run this company!

job_title: Community Relations Representative in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: RMHCS is  a wonderful place to work with a fantastic mission, to help seniors stay independent and healthy as long as possible by providing all inclusive health care. We also offer transpiration to our participants for medical appointments or for visits to our PACE Center.  Our participants enjoy socialization and recreational activities to keep them young!
cons: There are still Seniors who have not heard about, or don't understand the wonderful work we do. Let's get the word out!

job_title: Home Health RN in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Family friendly
Takes very good care of employees
Upper management takes complaints and suggestions seriously
Good pay
Excellent benefits
Provided with all tools and training needed to do the job
cons: Really don't care for  the electronic medical record system (EMR)

job_title: in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Dedicated co-workers who care about the participants.  Team work with multiple disciplines is excellent.  For the individual employee, health benefits are very reasonably priced.  PTO accrual is fairly good after a couple years.
cons: Increasing work load due to the growth of the program, especially with employee turnover over this past year. Increasing responsibilities that are not reflected in the job titles or in the salaries offered.  Insurance cost for families is expensive.

job_title: Maintenance Supervisor in Helena, MT
pros: Love to work for the elderly and provide a safe home
cons: Administration  at my place of employment expects to much and micromanage my department and has veiled  hostilities against my coworkers and teammates I feel  as if my employment  with them will  be terminated I am currently taking care of personal matters due to a death in my immediate family  and shouldn't  have to worry about weather or not l will  have a job to return  to!

job_title: Reception in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: PACE provides a vital service to vulnerable seniors in Colorado Springs. Many of the employees really care about the clients. The health care plan and paid time off are very good which somewhat balances low pay.
cons: Too many employees including supervisors believe they are promoting a team atmosphere when the reality is small cliques of special status employees run the place. Job assignments are based on who you know or who you are related to. Competency is secondary to personality and the organization suffers. It is poorly run with many managers always in crisis mode and looking for a scapegoat.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Love working with the staff/ and working with the seniors in our community. I Believe in there commitment to give better quality of life for the seniors.
cons: more communication between departments and management just so everyone know about changes that go on.

review_title: Great company with compassion and care
